channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8471] Server-side, remove convertion from pb type to client type before we call method
item.description:
In the regionserver, when the rpc receives a call, the call is described using protobufs. Before we make the server-side invocation, we do a transform on the pb param objects to make a native pojo – e.g. from a pb Puts into an hbase o.a.h.h.client.Put – and only then do we make the call against the server.

On the way out, similar, before putting the result on the wire, we will do a convertion from o.a.h.h.client.Result into pb Result.

This issue is about our first INVESTIGATING if it is possible to do away w/ this marshalling/unmarshalling serverside especially given the pb objects themselves are rich in accessor and getters, etc. If it is possible to do w/ pbs alone serverside, then we should go ahead and rip out all the serverside convertions.
item.summary: Server-side, remove convertion from pb type to client type before we call method

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
If it is possible to do w/ pbs alone serverside

Looks good so that we can avoid the to&fro conversion. Only point I would like to highlight is we would then contact the CP hooks with the pb objects rather than old POJOs Put, Delete etc.

Anoop Sam John Yes. Good point.

We could do this piecemeal. We could start w/ the Result object on the way out; try and undo its use inside in the server.

We could start w/ the Result object on the way out; try and undo its use inside in the server.

+1 we can start with that.. I can take a look at it on weekend.

some CP hooks takes org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Result Like below one
postScannerNext(final ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> c, final InternalScanner s, final List<Result> result, final int limit,final boolean hasNext)

What CP guys to say on this? Andrew Purtell?

I don't know of an existing use case that manipulates a Result or the list of Results in a CP hook, but to afford that possibility is why those hooks take that argument. Substituting PB objects for POJOs will be fine as long as they can be manipulated within the hook to change what is being passed back to the client.

Anoop Sam John Could CPs take Cells or a CellScanner? Might have to be an Iterable<Cell> object. See CellUtil and how it is used in ipc. If there is only one Result going back, then could be simple Iterable<Cell> that you pass in and get back. If cp wants to change what is Iterated, it can or just do pass-through.
Working on this.. Hopefully by next week I can come up with some thing which will avoid the Result copying. (POJO to protobuf at server and vice versa at the client side)

Patch with avoiding Result copying. Will see later how/whether we can change Mutations case also.
With PerformanceEvaluation tool scanRange1000, I am able to see 10-15% reduction in latency with patch.(Just 1 client running.)
And for this there is no change needed in any CP hooks.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12583825/HBASE-8471.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
